pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:0.4.eng: 3. The training rule on indecent speech

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī araññe viharati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Udāyī was staying in a beautiful dwelling in the wilderness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.3.pli: Tassāyasmato vihāro abhirūpo hoti dassanīyo pāsādiko.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā itthiyo ārāmaṃ āgamaṃsu vihārapekkhikāyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.4.eng: On one occasion a number of women came to the monastery to see the dwellings.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.5.pli: Atha kho tā itthiyo yenāyasmā udāyī tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.7.eng: “Venerable, we would like to see your dwelling.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī tā itthiyo vihāraṃ pekkhāpetvā tāsaṃ itthīnaṃ vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati yācatipi āyācatipi pucchatipi paṭipucchatipi ācikkhatipi anusāsatipi akkosatipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.8.eng: Then, after showing them his dwelling, he praised and disparaged their private parts; he requested and implored, asked and enquired, described, instructed, and abused their private parts.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.8.comm: Vaccamaggaṁ passāvamaggaṁ refer respectively to the anus and the genitals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.9.pli: Yā tā itthiyo chinnikā dhuttikā ahirikāyo tā āyasmatā udāyinā saddhiṃ uhasantipi ullapantipi ujjagghantipi uppaṇḍentipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.9.eng: The shameless and indecent women flirted with Udāyī; they called out to him, laughed with him, and teased him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.10.pli: Yā pana tā itthiyo hirimanā tā nikkhamitvā bhikkhū ujjhāpenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.10.eng: But after leaving, those of them who had a sense of shame complained to the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.12.pli: Sāmikenapi mayaṃ evaṃ vuttā na iccheyyāma, kiṃ panāyyena udāyinā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.12.eng: We wouldn’t want to hear such speech from our own husbands, let alone from Venerable Udāyī.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.1.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.1.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.2.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī speak indecently to women?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.3.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.3.eng: They rebuked Udāyī in many ways and told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.4.eng: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.5.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you spoke like this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.8.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.8.eng: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.9.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.9.eng: How could you speak like this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.10.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito no sarāgāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.10.eng: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of passion …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.11.eng: the stilling of the fevers of worldly pleasures?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.14.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāseyya yathā taṃ yuvā yuvatiṃ methunupasaṃhitāhi, saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, speaks indecent words to a woman, as a young man might to a young woman and referring to sexual intercourse, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.6.eng: having lust, longing for, in love with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.8.pli: rattampi cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ, duṭṭhampi cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ mūḷhampi cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.8.eng: a lustful mind is distorted; an angry mind is distorted; a confused mind is distorted.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.9.pli: Api ca rattaṃ cittaṃ imasmiṃ atthe adhippetaṃ vipariṇatanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.9.eng: But in this case “distorted” refers to the lustful mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.11.pli: manussitthī, na yakkhī, na petī, na tiracchānagatā. Viññū paṭibalā subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.11.eng: a female human being, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal. She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is decent and what is indecent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.13.eng: speech connected with the anus, the vagina, or sexual intercourse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.16.eng: As a young man might to a young woman:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.17.pli: daharo dahariṃ, taruṇo taruṇiṃ, kāmabhogī kāmabhoginiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.17.eng: a male youth to a female youth, a boy to a girl, a male who indulges in worldly pleasures to a female who indulges in worldly pleasures.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.20.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.21.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.1.pli: Dve magge ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati, avaṇṇampi bhaṇati, yācatipi, āyācatipi, pucchatipi, paṭipucchatipi, ācikkhatipi, anusāsatipi, akkosatipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.1.eng: Referring to the two private orifices, he praises, disparages, requests, implores, asks, enquires, describes, instructs, abuses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.3.eng: extols, praises, commends the two private orifices.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.5.eng: despises, reviles, censures the two private orifices.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.7.eng: saying, “Give to me; you should give to me.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.9.eng: saying, “When will you please your mother?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.12.eng: “When will there be a good opportunity, a good time, a good moment?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.13.eng: “When will I have sexual intercourse with you?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.15.eng: saying, “How do you give to your husband?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.16.eng: “How do you give to your lover?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.18.eng: saying, “So you give to your husband like this,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.19.eng: and to your lover like this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.21.pli: puṭṭho bhaṇati— “evaṃ dehi. Evaṃ dentā sāmikassa piyā bhavissati manāpā cā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.21.eng: when asked, he says, “Give like this. If you do, you’ll be dear and pleasing to your husband.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.23.pli: apuṭṭho bhaṇati— “evaṃ dehi. Evaṃ dentā sāmikassa piyā bhavissati manāpā cā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.23.eng: without being asked, he says, “Give like this. If you do, you’ll be dear and pleasing to your husband.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.0.2.eng: Referring to the private parts of a single person or animal

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.1.pli: Itthī ca hoti itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.1.eng: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.2.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati yācatipi āyācatipi pucchatipi paṭipucchatipi ācikkhatipi anusāsatipi akkosatipi, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.2.eng: If the monk, referring to the anus or the vagina of the woman, praises, disparages, requests, implores, asks, enquires, describes, instructs, or abuses, he commits an offense entailing suspension. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.3.eng: … (To be expanded as in Bu Ss 2:3.1.3–Bu Ss 2:3.1.49, with appropriate substitutions.) …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.3.comm: There are no instructions in the Pali or in the commentaries for how the expansion here or below is to be done. I therefore assume it is to be done in accordance with the previous rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.4.0.eng: Referring to the private parts of two beings of the same kind

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.4.1.pli: Dve itthiyo dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.4.1.eng: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.5.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.5.eng: If the monk, referring to the anus or the vagina of both women, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.6.eng: or abuses, he commits two offenses entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.7.eng: … (To be expanded as in Bu Ss 2:3.2.4–Bu Ss 2:3.2.26, with appropriate substitutions.) …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.8.0.eng: Referring to the private parts of two beings of different kinds

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.8.1.pli: Itthī ca paṇḍako ca ubhinnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.8.1.eng: It is a woman and a paṇḍaka, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.9.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ ubhinnaṃ vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.9.eng: If the monk, referring to the anus or the vagina of both of them, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.10.eng: or abuses, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.11.eng: … (To be expanded as in Bu Ss 2:3.3.4–Bu Ss 2:3.3.61, with appropriate substitutions.) …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.0.eng: Referring to other parts of the body: below the collar bone and above the knees

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.1.pli: Itthī ca hoti itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.1.eng: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.2.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ṭhapetvā adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.2.eng: If the monk, referring to any part of the woman below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.3.eng: or abuses, he commits a serious offense. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.4.pli: Dve itthiyo dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.4.eng: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.5.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ṭhapetvā adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.5.eng: If the monk, referring to any part of both women below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.6.eng: or abuses, he commits two serious offenses. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.7.pli: Itthī ca paṇḍako ca ubhinnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.7.eng: It is a woman and a paṇḍaka, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.8.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ ubhinnaṃ vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ṭhapetvā adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.8.eng: If the monk, referring to any part of both of them below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.9.eng: or abuses, he commits one serious offense and one offense of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.0.eng: Referring to other parts of the body: above the collar bone or below the knees

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.1.pli: Itthī ca hoti itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.1.eng: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.2.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā ubbhakkhakaṃ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.2.eng: If the monk, referring to any part of the woman above the collar bone or below the knees, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.3.eng: or abuses, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.4.pli: Dve itthiyo dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.4.eng: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.5.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ ubbhakkhakaṃ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.5.eng: If the monk, referring to any part of both women above the collar bone or below the knees, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.6.eng: or abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.7.pli: Itthī ca paṇḍako ca ubhinnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.7.eng: It is a woman and a paṇḍaka, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.8.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ ubhinnaṃ ubbhakkhakaṃ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.8.eng: If the monk, referring to any part of both of them above the collar bone or below the knees, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.9.eng: or abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.0.eng: Referring to anything connected to the body

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.1.pli: Itthī ca hoti itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.1.eng: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.2.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.2.eng: If the monk, referring to anything connected to the woman’s body, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.3.eng: or abuses, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.4.pli: Dve itthiyo dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.4.eng: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.5.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.5.eng: If the monk, referring to anything connected to the body of both women, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.6.eng: or abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.7.pli: Itthī ca paṇḍako ca ubhinnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.7.eng: It is a woman and a paṇḍaka, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.8.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ ubhinnaṃ kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.8.eng: If the monk, referring to anything connected to the body of both of them, praises, disparages …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.9.eng: or abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.2.eng: if he is aiming at something beneficial;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.3.eng: if he is aiming at giving a teaching;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.4.eng: if he is aiming at giving an instruction;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.10.eng: I hope the path has an end,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.11.eng: Faith, with a gift, with work.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī navarattaṃ kambalaṃ pārutā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.1.eng: At one time a certain woman was wearing a newly dyed woolen cloak.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu sāratto taṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.2.eng: A lustful monk said to her,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.4.eng: She did not understand and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.5.eng: “Yes, venerable, it’s a newly dyed woolen cloak.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.6.pli: Tassa kukkuccaṃ ahosi “bhagavatā sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ, kacci nu kho ahaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.6.eng: He became anxious and thought, “The Buddha has laid down a training rule. Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing suspension?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.7.eng: He told the Buddha, who said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.9.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī kharakambalaṃ pārutā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.1.eng: At one time a certain woman was wearing a coarse woolen cloak.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu sāratto taṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.2.eng: A lustful monk said to her,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.4.eng: She did not understand and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.5.eng: “Yes, venerable, it’s a coarse woolen cloak.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.8.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī navāvutaṃ kambalaṃ pārutā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.1.eng: At one time a certain woman was wearing a newly woven woolen cloak.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu sāratto taṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.2.eng: A lustful monk said to her,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.4.eng: She did not understand and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.5.eng: “Yes, venerable, it’s a newly woven woolen cloak.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.8.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī kharakambalakaṃ pārutā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.1.eng: At one time a certain woman was wearing a rough woolen cloak.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu sāratto taṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.2.eng: A lustful monk said to her,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.4.eng: She did not understand and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.5.eng: “Yes, venerable, it’s a rough woolen cloak.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.8.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī pāvāraṃ pārutā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.1.eng: At one time a certain woman was wearing a fleecy upper robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu sāratto taṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.2.eng: A lustful monk said to her,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.4.eng: She did not understand and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.5.eng: “Yes, venerable, it’s a fleecy upper robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.8.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī khettaṃ vapāpetvā āgacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.1.eng: At one time a certain woman was returning after having had a field sown.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu sāratto taṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.2.eng: A lustful monk said to her,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.4.eng: She did not understand and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.5.eng: “Yes, venerable, but the furrow isn’t closed yet.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.8.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu paribbājikaṃ paṭipathe passitvā sāratto taṃ paribbājikaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.7.1.eng: At one time a lustful monk saw a female wanderer coming in the opposite direction. He said to her,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.7.2.eng: “Sister, I hope the path has an end?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.7.3.eng: She did not understand and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sāratto aññataraṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.8.1.eng: At one time a lustful monk said to a woman,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.8.3.pli: Api ca yaṃ sāmikassa desi taṃ nāmhākaṃ desī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.8.3.eng: yet you don’t give us what you give your husband.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.9.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sāratto aññataraṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.9.1.eng: At one time a lustful monk said to a woman,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.9.3.pli: Api ca yaṃ aggadānaṃ taṃ nāmhākaṃ desī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.9.3.eng: yet you don’t give us the highest gift.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī kammaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.1.eng: At one time a certain woman was doing some work.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.2.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu sāratto taṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.2.eng: A lustful monk said to her,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.9.eng: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.10.eng: The training rule on indecent speech, the third, is finished.
